metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32207 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
When curl < 7.84.0 saves cookies, alt-svc and hsts data to local files, itmakes the operation atomic by finalizing the operation with a rename from atemporary name to the final target file name.In that rename operation, itmight accidentally *widen* the permissions for the target file, leaving theupdated file accessible to more users than intended.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
libcurl3-nss - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
libcurl4 - 7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.81.0-1ubuntu1.3').
